content: Jussie Smollett Back in Hot Water? Were charges dropped too soon? Brothers sue Smollett over deformation. Daniel Goldman Blocked Unblock Follow Following Apr 23 Did you think that the Jussie Smollett story was over? Honestly, I kind of thought it was and put it behind me. But it seems that Abel and Ola Osundairo, the brothers involved in the Jussie Smollett incident, weren’t too happy about taking all the blame for the apparent hoax attack against him. Now they’re suing over deformation. While the lawsuit is technically directed at Smollett’s lawyer, the claim is that the attack was indeed a hoax and that it was Smollett’s idea and that he paid them to attack him. Jussie Smollett case: Brothers accused of carrying out attack sue actor's legal team for defamation The brothers who say actor Jussie Smollett paid them to stage his January assault are now suing his legal team for… www.usatoday.com One has to wonder a number of things about this case. First off, were the brothers originally questioned? Supposedly there wasn’t enough evidence to convict Smollett and so that’s why he was released. But if these two were willing to testify, this case should have gone to court. And if they were questioned, what did they say? You also have to wonder why they weren’t given some kind of deal to talk, or if they refused the deal. If they refused the deal, it’s harder to argue that the lawsuit is valid. If they weren’t given a deal, why not? Either way, something odd was going on. Finally, will Kim Fox have to face any consequences? Her office dropped charges against him, when apparently there was reason not to do so. What were her reasons then? Was it money? Was it race? Did she not want to look bad by daring to charge a black gay person? Personally, if she failed to investigate further for any of these reasons, she’s pathetic. There’s no issue with attacking her character for that decision. Unfortunately Fox has received a number of threats against her, since her decision. If there was wrongdoing, Fox should be criticized, heavily. She should be thrown out of her job, without any compensation or pension. But she absolutely should not be threatened. We must be better than that, or we’re no better than Smollett. I am interested to see what comes of this lawsuit. It could be nothing. But it could end up with Smollett facing jail time, and it could end up with Fox being fired, or even facing jail time as well. Ironically, in this whole mess, the one thing that has not happened is Smollett being fired. The movie and TV industry is normally so trigger happy when it comes to accusations that they immediately fire someone. So one still has to wonder if “ black privilege ” is involved here. Further Reading Charges Against Jussie Smollett Dropped Was it a declaration of innocence or black & rich privilege? medium.com
title_html: Jussie Smollett Back in Hot Water?
html:
Homepage
Homepage
Sign inGet started

Jussie Smollett Back in Hot Water?

Were charges dropped too soon? Brothers sue Smollett over deformation.

Daniel Goldman
Apr 23

Did you think that the Jussie Smollett story was over? Honestly, I kind of thought it was and put it behind me. But it seems that Abel and Ola Osundairo, the brothers involved in the Jussie Smollett incident, weren’t too happy about taking all the blame for the apparent hoax attack against him. Now they’re suing over deformation. While the lawsuit is technically directed at Smollett’s lawyer, the claim is that the attack was indeed a hoax and that it was Smollett’s idea and that he paid them to attack him.

Jussie Smollett case: Brothers accused of carrying out attack sue actor's legal team for defamation
The brothers who say actor Jussie Smollett paid them to stage his January assault are now suing his legal team for…www.usatoday.com

One has to wonder a number of things about this case. First off, were the brothers originally questioned? Supposedly there wasn’t enough evidence to convict Smollett and so that’s why he was released. But if these two were willing to testify, this case should have gone to court. And if they were questioned, what did they say?

You also have to wonder why they weren’t given some kind of deal to talk, or if they refused the deal. If they refused the deal, it’s harder to argue that the lawsuit is valid. If they weren’t given a deal, why not? Either way, something odd was going on.

Finally, will Kim Fox have to face any consequences? Her office dropped charges against him, when apparently there was reason not to do so. What were her reasons then? Was it money? Was it race? Did she not want to look bad by daring to charge a black gay person? Personally, if she failed to investigate further for any of these reasons, she’s pathetic. There’s no issue with attacking her character for that decision.

Unfortunately Fox has received a number of threats against her, since her decision. If there was wrongdoing, Fox should be criticized, heavily. She should be thrown out of her job, without any compensation or pension. But she absolutely should not be threatened. We must be better than that, or we’re no better than Smollett.

I am interested to see what comes of this lawsuit. It could be nothing. But it could end up with Smollett facing jail time, and it could end up with Fox being fired, or even facing jail time as well. Ironically, in this whole mess, the one thing that has not happened is Smollett being fired. The movie and TV industry is normally so trigger happy when it comes to accusations that they immediately fire someone. So one still has to wonder if “black privilege” is involved here.

Further Reading

Charges Against Jussie Smollett Dropped
Was it a declaration of innocence or black & rich privilege?medium.com
